Package aa.test.selenium

Class AA01CreateUsersTest

java.lang.Object
aa.test.utils.AASeleniumManager
aa.test.selenium.AA01CreateUsersTest
@TestMethodOrder(org.junit.jupiter.api.MethodOrderer.OrderAnnotation.class) class AA01CreateUsersTest extends AASeleniumManager
 Testing the signup process.
 
 This test creates the user `automatedtests@allactivity.com` via the signup
 process in the webapp.
 
 This currently runs only when the tests are run in the docker,
 because the database on dev, staging, and production already contains the
 testuser.

  • Method Details

    • signUp

      @ParameterizedTest(name="{index} => email={1}, firstName={3}") @MethodSource void signUp(boolean workspaceForMe, String email, String password, String firstName, String lastName, String company, String project)
       Feature: Test a new sign up.
 
 Scenario: Click through the signup process, fill in the forms according to
 the parameters.
 Given this is the first Selenium test
 And this is the new database (the tests run in Docker)
 Then create the testing user that will be used later in the tests
 And check that the new user is logged in in the end of the process
 And log out and log in again to test that it works
      Parameters:
      workspaceForMe - if true, choose "workspace for myself" in the first step, otherwise choose "workspace for a team"
      email - the email address
      password - the password
      firstName - the first name
      lastName - the last name
      company - the company
      project - the project

    • signUp

      private static Stream<org.junit.jupiter.params.provider.Arguments> signUp()
       Feature: Test a new sign up.

 Scenario: Send the parameters to the signup method
      Returns:
      the stream of parameters, that are sent to the signup method
